# Saint Boniface church, Leeuwarden

|architecture_type=Church
|architecture_style=Gothic revival
|groundbreaking= 1882
|year_completed=
|height_max=
|designated=
}}
The Saint Boniface church (, )  is a church in Leeuwarden, the Netherlands.
History
The Gothic revival church was designed by Pierre Cuypers and built between 1882 and 1884.
In the Church dedicated to Saint Boniface is a pipe organ built by the French organ builder Aristide Cavaill√©-Coll. The organ was originally built for the Saint Willibrord College in Katwijk
The church is part of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Groningen-Leeuwarden
External links
* [http://www.bisdomgroningenleeuwarden.nl/ Catholic Diocese of Groningen-Leeuwarden]
